result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard V Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.
Court set restitution at zero.
No direct contact with victim unless approved by the court.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications, if needed.
 Court recommends this unit.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
cab

Defendant Howard V Mason in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 23 days time served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.  
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications, if needed.  Court recommends this unit.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No direct contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
If the defendant has completed all of the requirements of probation prior to the 16 months, except for the payments on the costs and surcharges, the agent can ask for earlier release.

 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Case adjourned for a review hearing in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Howard V Mason in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Howard V Mason in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.
Defense counsel met at side bar with the court and the district attorney.
Court will grant defense counsel's request and adjourn the case for a projected guilty plea date in Branch 36.
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Genevia G

Defendant Howard V Mason in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pro Se.  Defendant ordered to the Public Defender's Office to determine eligibility.  Defendant returns from Public Defender's Office.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Upon questioning, Court appoints Attorney Elizabeth Carlson subject to her accepting the case.  Court orders Attorney Carlson to be paid at the rate of $60 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.   Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
